column4: Breakingviews: Sumner Redstone's health ails corporate governance
column5: By Jennifer Saba Sumner Redstone's state of health is ailing the corporate governance at CBS and Viacom. The media mogul's mental capacity is being called into question again  this time by an ex-girlfriend in a lawsuit filed last week. Shareholders of both companies  which Redstone controls and chairs  deserve a clearer idea of whether the 92-year-old is fit to lead the boards.

column4: Judge rules out immediate medical check in suit on Redstone's mental competence
column5: LOS ANGELES A California court on Monday rejected a request from the former girlfriend of Sumner Redstone for the 92-year-old chairman of  Viacom Inc to undergo an immediate medical evaluation.

column4: Yunnan refinery changes meet environmental standards -CNPC newspaper
column5: BEIJING  Dec 1 Changes by PetroChina  to add a delayed coking unit at a large new refinery in southwestern China would still satisfy environmental requirements  according to a newspaper run by parent company China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC)  citing a team of experts.

column4: Brazil economy shrinking due to political uncertainty - ministry
column5: BRASILIA  Dec 1 Lingering political uncertainties are to blame for the worse-than-expected contraction of Brazil's economy in the third quarter  the Finance Ministry said in a statement on Tuesday.

column4: Fitch: Outlook for Brazilian Banks Remains Negative
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) SAO PAULO  December 01 (Fitch) Brazil's challenging operating environment and  economic recession are driving Fitch Ratings' negative outlook on the country's  banking sector. Higher interest rates and inflation  combined with further  economic slowdown and rising unemployment will materially pressure asset quality  metrics  credit costs and  ultimately  overall earnings. Local banks will likely  further constrain risk appetites in 2016

column4: UPDATE 1-Loeb's Third Point Offshore hedge fund nearly flat for year-sources
column5: BOSTON  Dec 1 Daniel Loeb's main portfolio at hedge fund Third Point is nearly flat for the year  putting the billionaire investor far ahead of some industry rivals who have suffered heavy losses this year.

column4: Orange hires Morgan Stanley and BNP as M&A advisers - sources
column5: LONDON/PARIS  Dec 1 French telecoms group Orange  has hired investment banks Morgan Stanley and BNP Paribas to assess the merits of doing a deal with other network operators in Europe  including Telecom Italia   two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

column4: Green investors take note: climate-focused mutual funds dabble in oil
column5: BOSTON  Dec 1 Several of the world's biggest climate-focused mutual funds have stakes in traditional oil and gas companies mixed in with their solar  wind and clean tech holdings  a potential shock to green investors seeking to avoid fossil fuels altogether.

column4: UnitedHealth CEO defends possible exit of Obamacare exchanges
column5: NEW YORK UnitedHealth Group Inc's chief executive officer on Tuesday defended the company's possible withdrawal from the Obamacare health insurance exchanges  calling the 2015 expansion into two dozen states a "bad decision."

column4: UnitedHealth CEO defends possible exit of Obamacare exchanges
column5: NEW YORK UnitedHealth Group Inc's  chief executive officer on Tuesday defended the company's possible withdrawal from the Obamacare health insurance exchanges  calling the 2015 expansion into two dozen states a "bad decision."

column4: UPDATE 3-UnitedHealth CEO defends possible exit of Obamacare exchanges
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 UnitedHealth Group Inc's  chief executive officer on Tuesday defended the company's possible withdrawal from the Obamacare health insurance exchanges  calling the 2015 expansion into two dozen states a "bad decision."

column4: UnitedHealth CEO defends review of Obamacare exchange participation
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 UnitedHealth Group Inc's  chief executive on Tuesday defended the company's recent disclosure that it would consider exiting the Obamacare health insurance exchanges in 2017  citing losses on health plans it said were designed to succeed.

column4: Vale sees at least $443 million mine disaster costs  long clean-up
column5: NEW YORK Brazil's Vale SA   said November's deadly mining disaster could cost it at least $443 million  but it was too early to put a price tag on what it expects to be a long clean-up from the pollution spilled in the dam burst.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Vale sees at least $443 mln mine disaster costs  long clean-up
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 Brazil's Vale SA   said November's deadly mining disaster could cost it at least $443 million  but it was too early to put a price tag on what it expects to be a long clean-up from the pollution spilled in the dam burst.

column4: LATAM WRAP-Vale  Samarco weaken over disaster costs
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 (IFR) - Bonds issued by Brazilian miner Vale widened on Tuesday as officials in New York fended off questions about the financial impact of the recent dam burst at joint venture Samarco.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Vale cuts 2016 budget  sees $443 mln mine disaster costs
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 Brazil's Vale SA   prepared investors on Tuesday for a difficult 2016  unveiling a plan that includes cutting capital investment to about $6 billion and $443 million in expected costs to clean up a November mine disaster.

column4: CORRECTED-Brazil's Vale estimates $443 mln Samarco impact in 2016
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 1 Brazilian miner Vale SA  said in a Tuesday presentation that the impact of the Samarco dam burst could be $443 million in 2016 and that it planned to reduce investments to around $6 billion next year.

column4: BRIEF-Vale says it has no clear estimate of Samarco disaster cost
column5: Dec 1 Vale SA executives spoke on Tuesday at the New York Stock Exchanges for the Rio de Janeiro-based mining company's annual Vale Day investor conference

column4: Vale expects Goro nickel mine output to rise 50 pct in 2016
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 Brazilian miner Vale SA  expects a 50 percent increase in output from its Goro New Caledonia Nickel project in 2016  non-ferrous metals chief Jennifer Maki said at an investor conference at the New York Stock Exchange on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Vale says Samarco recovery will take time  assistance
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 1 Environmental recovery from a burst dam disaster at a Brazilian mine half-owned by Vale SA  will take time and a lot of help  miner Chief Executive Murilo Ferreira said at an event in New York on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Vale estimates $443 mln Samarco impact in 2016
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 1 Brazilian miner Vale SA  said in a Tuesday presentation that the impact of the Samarco dam burst could be $443 million in 2016 and that it planned to reduce investments by around $6 billion next year.

column4: Brazil sues BHP  Vale for $5 billion in damages for mine disaster
column5: BRASILIA Brazil filed a lawsuit on Monday against two of the world's largest mining companies for 20 billion Brazilian reais ($5.2 billion) to clean up what it says was its worst environmental disaster  caused by the collapse of a tailings dam.

column4: Appaloosa questions TerraForm Power's Vivint deal
column5: Hedge fund Appaloosa Management LP said SunEdison Inc yieldco TerraForm Power Inc's proposed purchase of residential solar assets from SunEdison represented a change in TerraForm's business model and put shareholders at risk.

column4: UPDATE 2-Appaloosa questions TerraForm Power's Vivint deal
column5: * TerraForm Power shares jump as much as 33 pct   (Adds details  background  analyst comments)

column4: Wells Fargo CEO complains about Fed debt issuance requirement
column5: Wells Fargo & Co CEO John Stumpf said on Tuesday he disagrees with a new rule designed to boost one of the bank's cushions for absorbing losses.
